headline.main: Renamed Chief Steward Of Reconverted Uruguay

docs.snippet: PHOENIX, Ariz. -- After an unusually dull pre-season period (October through January) Arizona's winter resorts have picked up rapidly this month and the entire state now seems to be on its way to a record 1948 season.
docs.lead_paragraph: PHOENIX, Ariz. -- After an unusually dull pre-season period (October through January) Arizona's winter resorts have picked up rapidly this month and the entire state now seems to be on its way to a record 1948 season.

headline.main: ARIZONA PICKS UP; New Guest Ranches and Trailer Camps Make Room for More Winter Visitors

docs.snippet: A dual ceremony, at which the reconverted Moore-McCormack liner Uruguay will receive the Naval Reserve Pennant and the ship's memorial library will be dedicated, will be held aboard the vessel tomorrow at Pier 32, North River.
docs.lead_paragraph: A dual ceremony, at which the reconverted Moore-McCormack liner Uruguay will receive the Naval Reserve Pennant and the ship's memorial library will be dedicated, will be held aboard the vessel tomorrow at Pier 32, North River.

headline.main: DOUBLE CEREMONY PLANNED FOR LINER; Moore-McCormack's Uruguay to Get Naval Reserve Pennant and Library Tomorrow

docs.snippet: MONTEVIDEO, Uruguay, Feb. 8 -- Business leaders in Uruguay believe that imports to this country from the United States will not be curtailed for long, according to a statement issued today by the Montevideo office of the Chamber of Commerce of the...
docs.lead_paragraph: MONTEVIDEO, Uruguay, Feb. 8 -- Business leaders in Uruguay believe that imports to this country from the United States will not be curtailed for long, according to a statement issued today by the Montevideo office of the Chamber of Commerce of the United States in Uruguay.
docs.abstract: leaders see ERP trade as aid; US exporters seen assured of payments under import permits; needs noted

headline.main: URUGUAY EXPECTS TRADE TO IMPROVE; Purchases There for Europe Expected to Restore Dollar Credit, Stimulate Imports

byline.original: Special to THE NEW YORK TIMES

docs.snippet: The disturbance in the stock and commodity markets last week passed over without incident so far as the main body of the foreign exchanges was concerned. At least there was no comparable erratic swing of rates. Markets were quiet and values showed no...
docs.lead_paragraph: The disturbance in the stock and commodity markets last week passed over without incident so far as the main body of the foreign exchanges was concerned. At least there was no comparable erratic swing of rates. Markets were quiet and values showed no great change over the preceding week.

docs.snippet: WEMBLEY, England, Feb. 9 (AP) -- Richard Miles of New York and the Thall sisters, Leah and Thelma, of Columbus, Ohio, advanced tonight in the world's table-tennis championships.
docs.lead_paragraph: WEMBLEY, England, Feb. 9 (AP) -- Richard Miles of New York and the Thall sisters, Leah and Thelma, of Columbus, Ohio, advanced tonight in the world's table-tennis championships.

headline.main: U.S. PLAYERS ADVANCE; Thall Sisters and Miles Win at World Table Tennis

docs.snippet: The Moore-McCormack liner Uruguay became yesterday the forty-first unit of the American Merchant Marine to be accepted into the Naval Reserve in a ceremony aboard the vessel at Pier 32, North River.
docs.lead_paragraph: The Moore-McCormack liner Uruguay became yesterday the forty-first unit of the American Merchant Marine to be accepted into the Naval Reserve in a ceremony aboard the vessel at Pier 32, North River.
docs.abstract: gets Navy reserve pennant; illus; T K Locke memorial library dedicated

docs.snippet: HAVANA, Feb. 12 -- A new controversy between economically developed and undeveloped countries at the United Nations Conference on Trade and Employment came to a climax today in a debate over the number of countries needed to put the World Trade...
docs.lead_paragraph: HAVANA, Feb. 12 -- A new controversy between economically developed and undeveloped countries at the United Nations Conference on Trade and Employment came to a climax today in a debate over the number of countries needed to put the World Trade Charter into force if it is approved by the conference.
docs.abstract: undeveloped nations seek to amend clause on number of charter ratifications needed; com apptd on issue

byline.original: Special to THE NEW YORK TIMES

docs.snippet: GEORGE WASHINGTON'S birthday, so faithfully remembered and celebrated by resort hotels and transportation systems, will be especially gala this year, for it falls on next Sunday and is observed on Monday.
